ac:structured-macro.ac:rich-text-body: This section documents the outcomes of a Line of Inquiry and Observation that are guided by a set of Clinical Interoperability Principles that at a high level describe what a clinician needs in a successful Interoperability solution. The Clinical Interoperability Principles guide a line of inquiry, observation or investigation that help to surface Clinical Requirements.

This section documents the outcomes of a Line of Inquiry and Observation that are guided by a set of Clinical Interoperability Principles that at a high level describe what a clinician needs in a successful Interoperability solution. The Clinical Interoperability Principles guide a line of inquiry, observation or investigation that help to surface Clinical Requirements.

ac:structured-macro.ac:parameter: 1. I need to receive and send notifications about my patients and transitions of care.

ul.li: What notifications do I need to send?
What notifications do I need to receive?
Why do I need to send and receive these notifications
What transitions of care need notification?
Where do I want/ need to receive this information?
From where do I want / need to send this information?

ac:structured-macro.ac:parameter: 2. I need to know the data is trustworthy and secure and who it is from.

ul.li: Why is this important?
How do I know who it is from?
How do I know it is trustworthy?
How do I know it is secure?
How do I know it is from an authoritative source?

ac:structured-macro.ac:parameter: 3. I need clinically relevant information about my patient.

ul.li: What is clinically relevant in this particular situation?
What information do I need?
Why this information?

ac:structured-macro.ac:parameter: 4. I need to share and view relevant patient information with others in the circle of care including the patient.

ul.li: Who do I need to share information with?
What information do I need to share?
How often do I need to share this information?
Why do I need to share this information?
Whose information do I need to view?
How often do I need to view it?
How do I share information with the patient?
How does the patient share information with me?

ac:structured-macro.ac:parameter: 5. I need information to be consistent in its meaning. (1)

ul.li: What is meant by consistent in its meaning?
Why is this important?
What happens if it is not consistent in meaning?

ac:structured-macro.ac:parameter: 6. I need available clinical data to be aggregated and assembled to support care delivery and health system use.

ul.li: How does it need to be aggregated and assembled?
Why do I need it to be aggregated and assembled?

ac:structured-macro.ac:parameter: 1. I need information access to be easy, intuitive, supporting my workflow, with minimal steps and clicks.

ul.li: What is your current workflow?
At what point in your workflow will you share or receive information?
How does this impact your workflow?
What do you need in order to make these changes easy, intuitive and support your workflow with minimal steps and clicks?

ac:structured-macro.ac:parameter: 2. I need this information to be available in one place and assembled together with other clinically relevant information.

ul.li: Where should it be assembled?
What other clinically relevant information?
Why is this important?

ac:structured-macro.ac:parameter: 3. I need clinical decision support tools available to me at the point of care (relevant alerts and evidence based reference guidelines).

ul.li: What type of clinical decision support?
When is it required?

ac:structured-macro.ac:parameter: 4. I need this information to be available to me when and where I need it.

ul.li: When do I need it?
Where do I need it?
How do I need to see it?

ac:structured-macro.ac:parameter: 5. I need to be in control of how I use a system and how I choose to interact with data.

ul.li: What does this mean to me?
What flexibility do I have to manipulate the data â€“ i.e. graph it, trend it, see only recent, see all history, etc.

ac:structured-macro.ac:parameter: 6. I need to know that the system supports my clinical guidelines, standards of practice and regulatory requirements.

ul.li: What are the clinical guidelines?
How should the system help to support those clinical guidelines?
What are the standards of practice?
How should the system help to support those standards of practice?
What are the regulatory requirements?
How should the system help to adhere to regulatory requirements?

ac:structured-macro.ac:parameter: 7. I need to work directly with the solution vendor to ensure that what gets designed and built is something I will use.

ul.li: Does the vendor understand my needs?
Does the vendor understand my workflow?
